poem:
### Rooted Echoes

No Welsh art,  
they cried, forgetting  
mountain whispers,  
river songs, the  
canvas of valleys—  
each brushstroke  
memory-bound,  
hidden in the folds  
of familiar shadows.  
Cardiff holds them,  
hearth and heart,  
a gallery of earth,  
longing to be  
seen, known—  
a nation's echo.
